Upon the Bridge.Text: Setup: Set aside Devouring Werewolf, Draugluin, Bridge to the Isle and Wolf-Sauron. Create a pit area with stage 2A and follow the setup instructions on that card.

The Pits of Sauron.Encounter Set: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
The Pits of Sauron.Text: When Revealed: Search the encounter deck for Finrod Felagund and Eyes in the Dark and add both to the pit area. Choose one hero to be placed in the pit area. That hero is captured. The controlling player may immediately replace the captured hero with another of his choice.

Tol-in-Gaurhoth.Encounter Set: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
Tol-in-Gaurhoth.Text: When Revealed: Add Wolf-Sauron to the staging area. Reveal 1 encounter card per player.

Isle of Werewolves rules.Encounter Set: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves

Doors of Angband.Encounter Set: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
Doors of Angband.Text: Setup: Add Carcharoth to the staging area. Set Morgoth and all objectives and unique locations aside out of play. Set your threat equal to the number of heroes you control.

Descent into Darkness.Encounter Set: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
Descent into Darkness.Text: When Revealed: Remove Carcharoth from play. Add Pits of Angband, Thrall Quarters, and Tunnels of Shadow to the staging area. Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 enemy and add it to the staging area.

The Greatest Deed.Encounter Set: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth

To See the Light.Encounter Set: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
To See the Light.Text: When Revealed: Remove Morgoth from play. Add Carcharoth to the staging area, removing any damage that was previously placed.

Seat of Morgoth rules.Encounter Set: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth

Ride Forth in the Morning.Encounter Set: Custom Set - Hunting of the Wolf
Ride Forth in the Morning.Text: Setup: Place Carcharoth the Tormented and Gates of Menegroth aside, out of play. Shuffle all other copies of Carcharoth into a Carcharoth deck. Each player must search the encounter deck for 1 different location and add it to the staging area. Put the Beleg Strongbow objective ally into play.

At Last Upon the Wolf.Encounter Set: Custom Set - Hunting of the Wolf
At Last Upon the Wolf.Text: When Revealed: Remove Carcharoth from play and put the Carcharoth deck aside. Add Carcharoth the Tormented to the staging area. Remove half of the damage on Carcharoth (rounding up).

Ceorl.Text: Action: Spend 1 Ê resource to ready Ceorl. Then, you may give control of Ceorl to another player. Any player may trigger this action. (Limit once per phase).

D\u00e9orwine.Text: Action: While Déorwine is defending, spend 1 Ì resource to cancel a shadow effect dealt to the attacking enemy. Any player may trigger this action.

X is the number of players in the game.

Gate Key.Text:
If unattached, return Gate Key to the staging area and it gains: “Action: Exhaust a hero to claim Gate Key and attach it to that hero.”
Action: Exhaust Gate Key and attached hero and spend 3 resources from attached hero’s resource pool to look at the facedown side of a Temple of the Deceived.

Faithless Desecrator.Text: While engaged with a player, Faithless Desecrator contributes its $ to the total $ in the staging area.

Sunken Ruins.Text: When Revealed: Each Uncharted location in the staging area gets +1 $ until the end of the phase. If the active location has the Ruins trait, discard 1 resource from each hero and objective ally in play.

Add that location to the staging area to choose an non-unique enemy in the staging area and shuffle it into the encounter deck.

The Master Ring.Text: Response: Exhaust The One Ring and raise your threat by 1 to cancel the effects of an encounter card just revealed from the encounter deck and discard that card. Then, reveal an encounter card.

Then if there are at lest 3 resources here, remove 3 of them and shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Discard cards from the top until X enemies are discarded, where X is the number of players. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

Bribes.Text: Add +1 to the total $ in the staging area for each resource here.Forced: When the active location is explored, discard the top X cards of each player`s deck, when X is that location`s $. Then, place 1 resource here for each event discarded this way.

If Secret Cultist is discarded, or the attached ally`s owner is eliminated, discard attached ally.`)

Darkness in the East.Text: When Revealed: Raise each player`s threat by X, where X is the active location`s $. If there is no active location, Darkness in the East gains surge.

Unwelcome Travelers.Text: Each location in the staging area gets +1 $.Forced: After Unwelcome Travelers becomes the current quest, the first player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and puts it into play engaged with him.

Tribute to Mordor.Text: Forced: At the end of the round, place 1 damage token here. Then, if there are 4 or more damage tokens here, remove 4 of them and reveal the top card of the Power of Mordor deck. If you cannot, the player lose the game.This stage cannot be the active quest while Thane Ulchor has any hit points remaining. When this stage is defeated, the players win the game.

Hall of Horrors.Text: X is 1 more than the number of quest stages in the victory display.Forced: When Hall of Horrors leaves play, each player deals X damage to a character he controls.

Ulchor's Guard.Text: While Thane of Ulchor is engaged with a player, Ulchor`s Guard engages that player.

Fanaticism.Text: While attached to an enemy, counts as a Condition attachment with the text: `Attached enemy gets +1 $, +1 Û, +1 Ú, and is immune to player card effects.`When Revealed: Attach to the Easterling enemy with the lowest Ú without a copy of Fanaticism. Otherwise, Fanaticism gains surge.

Twisted Tunnel.Text: When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Add that enemy to the staging area.
Twisted Tunnel.Shadow: Shadow: Defending character cannot ready until the end of the round.

Narrow Opening.Text: While Narrow Opening is the active location, each player cannot play more than 1 card each round.Forced: When Narrow Opening leaves play, each player discards 1 random card from his hand.

Crumbling Passage.Text: When Revealed: Make Crumbling Passage the active location, returning any previously active location to the staging area.Forced: When Crumbling Passage leaves play, deal 1 damage to each exhausted character.

Fearful Shadows.Text: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, treat the printed text box of each character as if it were blank (except for Traits).

Kham\u00fbl the Easterling.Encounter Set: A Shadow of the Past - Nightmare
Kham\u00fbl the Easterling.Text:
Khamûl the Easterling gets -30 engagement cost while The One Ring is exhausted.
Forced: At the beginning of the refresh phase, the engaged player makes a Hide 2 test. If the engaged player fails the hide test, Khamûl the Easterling makes an immediate attack.

The Tower of Barad-d\u00fbr.Text: Immune to player card effects.The player cannot travel here.Each player`s threat elimination level is reduced by 5.

Under the Watchful Eye.Text: When Revealed: Each player with more than 5 cards in his hand discards cards from his hand until he has only 5.Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, he raises his threat by 1.

The Armies of Mordor.Text: Forced: After a non-unique enemy engages a player, that enemy cannot take damage until the end of the round.

Covered in Darkness.Text: Each player`s threat cannot be reduced by more than 1 each round by player card effects.

Stinker.Text: When Revealed: Gollum makes an immediate attack. If no attach was made this way, discard all tokens from Sméagol and flip him to Gollum.
Stinker.Shadow: Shadow: Raise your threat by 2 (by 4 instead if attacking enemy is Gollum). Shuffle Stinker back into the encounter deck.

Sm\u00e9agol.Text: Cannot have attachments. Setup: Shuffle 2 copies of Stinker into the encounter deck.Response: After you travel to a location, raise your threat by 1 to draw 1 card.

Fellowship.Text: You cannot play non-unique allies or put non-unique allies into play. Forced: When you control exactly 9 unique characters, flip this card over.

Chased by Easterlings.Text: Setup: Set Warriors of the East aside, out of play. Add Easterling Pursuit and 1 copy of River Running to the staging area. Each player adds 1 different Easterling enemy to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

The Crossing of Araw.Text: When Revealed: Add Warriors of the East to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until X enemies are discarded, where X is the number of players. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

A City in Turmoil.Text: Setup: Set each plot objective and each Cultist enemy aside, out of play. Each player searches the encounter deck for a different location and adds it to the staging area. One of those locations must be Side Street. Shuffle the encounter deck.

The Shadow of Mordor.Text: When Revealed: Add 1 random set aside Plot objective to the staging area. Reveal 1 encounter card per player.

Leader of the Cult.Text: When Revealed: Add 1 random set-aside Cultist enemy to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards until X enemies are discarded, where X is one less than the number of players. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

The Forgotten Temple.Text: Setup: Shuffle each of the stage 2 quest cards together and place them facedown under this stage. Create The Power of Mordor deck (see insert) and set it next to the quest deck. Add Thane Ulchor and Tribute to Mordor to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

The Legacy of Mordor.Text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card per player.

Memory of the Dark Years.Text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card per player.

Shrine to Sauron.Text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card per player.

The Lord of Middle-earth.Text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card per player.

Bard son of Brand.Text: While playing an Item attachment, Bard son of Brand is considered to have the printed Ì, Î, and Ï icons. Response: When a character leaves play, return each attachment attached to that character to its owner’s hand. (Limit once per phase.)

North Realm Lookout.Text: North Realm Lookout gets +1 Ò and does not exhaust to quest while it has an Item attachment.

Warrior of Dale.Text: Reduce the cost to play Weapon attachments on Warrior of Dale by 1. Warrior of Dale gets +1 Û and gains Ranged while it has a Weapon attachment.

Long Lake Trader.Text: Action: Exhaust Long Lake Trader to move an Item attachment from a character you control to another eligible character.

Hauberk of Mail.Text: Attach to a Dale or Warrior character. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gets +1 Ú (and +1 hit point if attached character has the sentinel keyword).

Bow of Yew.Text: Attach to a Dale or Warrior character. Restricted. Response: After attached character is declared as an attacker, exhaust Bow of Yew to deal 1 damage to the defending enemy.

Map of Rhovanion.Text: Attach to a Dale or Scout character. Limit 1 per character. Response: After attached character commits to the quest, place 1 progress on the active location.

Necklace of Girion.Text: Guarded (enemy or location) Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +2 Ò and collects an additional resource during the resource phase.

Traffic from Dale.Text: Planning Action: Choose a Dale hero you control. Add 1 resource to its pool for each character you control with a player attachment. You can only play 1 copy of Traffic from Dale each round.

To Arms!.Text: Action: Choose an ally with a player attachment. Ready that ally.

Valour of the North.Text: Response: After a character is declared as an attacker or defender against an enemy with an attachment, that character gets +3 Û and +3 Ú until the end of this attack.

Bartering.Text: Planning Action: Choose a ready player attachment on a character you control. Return that attachment to its owner’s hand to reduce the cost of the next attachment played this phase by X, where is the chosen attachment’s cost.

Wooded Riverbank.Text: Forced: When Wooded Riverbank is explored, put the top card of the Evil Creatures deck into play engaged with the first player.
Wooded Riverbank.Shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

Frenzied Creature.Text: When Revealed: Add the top card of the Evil Creatures deck to the staging area and attach Frenzied Creature to it. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Attached enemy gets +1 $, +1 Û, +1 Ú and is immune to player card effects.”)
Frenzied Creature.Shadow: Shadow: Attach this card to attacking enemy.

Dangerous Crossing.Text: When Revealed: Each player assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is the total $ of the active location. If X is less than 3, Treacherous Crossing gains surge.
Dangerous Crossing.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the defending character is damaged).

Hills of Wilderland.Text: X is the number of characters controlled by the player with the most characters. Quest Action: Exhaust a character to reduce Hills of Wilderland $ by 1 until the end of the phase. Only the first player can trigger this effect.

Lonely Lands.Text: Lonely Lands gets +2 $ for each facedown card under it. While Lonely Lands is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After an event is played during the quest phase, place it facedown under Lonely Lands.”

Ruined Supplies.Text: Doomed 1. When Revealed: Each player must choose: either raise your threat by 1 for each ally you control, or deal 1 damage to each ally you control.
Ruined Supplies.Shadow: Shadow: Raise your threat by 1 for each enemy engaged with you.

Lost in the Wild.Text: When Revealed: The player with the most cards in his hand without a copy of Lost in the Wilderness adds Lost in the Wild to his hand. (While in a player’s hand, Lost in the Wild gains: “Cannot be discarded by player card effect. Forced: After you play a card, discard each card in your hand.”)

Searching for a Way Out.Text: Each objective-location, and each card guarding one, is immune to player card effects. Forced: When progress would be placed on the main quest, if there are no objective-locations in play, discard an equal number of cards from the encounter deck instead. Then, put the topmost objective-location in the encounter discard pile into play.

Overgrown Path.Text: Guarded (location). Travel: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Each player discards the top card of the encounter deck and assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is that card’s $. Forced: After the players travel here, advance to the next stage A, if able.

Abadoned Village.Text: Guarded (location). Travel: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Each player discards the top card of the encounter deck. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area. Forced: After the players travel here, advance to the next stage C, if able.

Bare Hilltop.Text: Guarded (enemy). Travel: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Each player discards the top card of the encounter deck. Add each location discarded this way to the staging area. Forced: After the players travel here, advance to the next stage A, if able.

Twilight Hall.Text: Cannot have attachments. Twilight Hall gets +1 $ for each character controlled by the first player. Forced: When Twilight Hall is explored, reveal 1 encounter card per player.

Ravenous Spider.Text: Forced: After Ravenous Spider attacks and destroys a character, the defending player exhausts a character he controls.
Ravenous Spider.Shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, exhaust a character you control.

Unseen Danger.Text: When Revealed: Each player removes a character he controls from the quest and discards the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card’s printed $ is greater than the removed character’s Ò, discard that character.
Unseen Danger.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +2 Û and +2 Ú if it is guarding a card.

Accursed Forest.Text: While Accursed Forest is in the staging area, ‘when revealed’ effects cannot be canceled. Travel: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck.

Swarms of Bats.Text: When Revealed: Each player discards each resource from each of his hero’s resource pools and raises his threat by 1 for each resource he discarded this way. If no resources were discarded this way, Swarm of Bats gains surge.
Swarms of Bats.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the defending character has an attachment).

Fire Drake.Text: Cannot have non-Dragon attachments. X is 1 more than the number of players. Forced: After the active location is explored, Fire-drake returns to the staging area and makes an immediate attack against each player in turn order.

Dragon Hoard.Text: Immune to player card effects. Fire-drake cannot take damage. Response: After Dragon Hoard becomes the active location, the first player chooses a player to attach an Artifact attachment from his hand to Dragon Hoard. That attachment gains the guarded (location) keyword. If that attachment has the printed guarded keyword, do not resolve it when the attachment enters play.

Iron Hills Mine.Text: While Iron Hills Mine is the active location, it gains: “Response: When Iron Hills Mine is explored, each player may return 1 card from his discard pile to his hand.” Travel: Each player discards the top 4 cards of his deck to travel here.

Contested Depths.Text: Contested Depths gets +1 $ for each location in the victory display. Forced: After the players travel to Contested Depths, either raise each player’s threat by 1 for each location in the victory display, or discard Contested Depths and replace it with the top card of the Caves deck.

Deep Chasm.Text: When faced with the option to travel, the players must travel to Deep Chasm if there is no active location.

Afraid of the Dark.Text: When Revealed: Attach to a questing hero and remove it from the quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Limit 1 per hero. While the active location has the Dark trait, reduce attached hero’s Ò to 0 and treat its text box as if it were blank, except for Traits.”)

Stone Troll.Text: Cannot have non-objective attachments. Forced: After Stone Troll attacks and destroys a character you control, discard 1 card from your hand for each excess point of damage dealt.
Stone Troll.Shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment you control.

Dark Tunnel.Text: While Dark Tunnel is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on Dark locations in the staging area.

Dragon Breath.Text: When Revealed: Attach to a Dragon enemy. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Limit 1 per enemy. Forced: When attached enemy attacks you, deal 1 damage to each character you control. Then, discard Dragon Breath.”)

Dragon Scales.Text: When Revealed: Attach to a Dragon enemy. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Limit 1 per enemy. Forced: When attached enemy would take any amount of damage, cancel all of that damage. Then, discard Dragon Scales.”)

Lost Armory.Text: Response: After Lost Armory becomes the active location, each player may search his deck for a Weapon or Armor attachment, add it to his hand, and shuffle his deck. Limit once per game for the group.

Ancient Treasury.Text: Response: After Ancient Treasury becomes the active location, each player may (choose one): reduce his threat by 3, draw 2 cards, or add 1 resource to a hero’s resource pool. Limit once per game for the group.

Crumbling Cavern.Text: Forced: After Crumbling Cavern becomes the active location, each player assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is the number of characters he controls.

Underground Lake.Text: X is the number of characters controlled by the player who controls the most characters. Forced: After an ally enters player, exhaust it.

Traveling North.Text: Setup: Set Woodman Village and The Old Ford aside, out of play. Create the Evil Creatures deck (see insert) and place it next to the quest deck. Shuffle the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until X locations are discarded, where X is the number of players. Add each discarded location to the staging area.

Woodmen Under Attack.Text: When Revealed: The first player adds Woodman Village to the staging area. Each other player reveals an encounter card.

The Passage of the Ford.Text: When Revealed: The first player adds The Old Ford to the staging area. Each other player takes the top card of the Evil Creatures deck and adds it to the staging area.

Woodman Village.Text: Immune to player card effects. Forced: When Woodman Village is explored, add the top card of the Evil Creatures deck to the staging area. Then, flip over Woodman Village and attach Haldan to the just-added enemy as a guarded objective.

Ambushed at Night.Text: Setup: Set the Spiders of Mirkwood and Dol Guldur Orcs encounter sets aside, out of play. The first player takes control of Haldan and adds Searching for a Way Out to the staging area. Each player adds 1 Forest Spider to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Carried Away.Text: When Revealed: Each player chooses a hero he controls, discards each token and attachment from that hero, and places it in the staging area. Each player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and attaches that enemy to the hero he owns in the staging area, guarding it.

Truly Lost.Text: When Revealed: Each player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until he discards a non-objective lcoation and adds it to the staging area. Each player places his hand of cards facedown under a different location in the staging area.

The Forest of Great Fear.Text: When Revealed: Remove Searching for a Way Out from the game. Search the remaining set-aside encounter set for the enemy with the most hit points and add it to the staging area. That enemy is the “nemesis” until it leaves play.

Escape from Taur-nu-Fuin.Text: When Revealed: Remove Searching for a Way Out from the game. Starting with the first player, each player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until he discards an enemy and puts that enemy into play engaged with him.

The Iron Hills.Text: Setup: Build the Caves deck (see insert) and set it next to the quest deck. Set Fire-drake, Dragon Hoard, and the Dragon Might encounter sets aside, out of play. Shuffle the encounter deck. Each player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until he discards an enemy or location and adds that card to the staging area.

The Lower Depths.Text: When Revealed: Place Dragon Hoard on the bottom of the Caves deck. Add Fire-drake to the staging area and shuffle the Dragon Might encounter set into the encounter deck.

The Fire Worm.Text: When Revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Dragon treachery and attach it to Fire-drake, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Passage Through Mirkwood.Text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

Ungoliant's Brood.Text: Forced: After you engage Ungoliant's Brood, your cards cannot ready for the remainder of the round.
Ungoliant's Brood.Shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, exhaust all characters you control.

Forest Flies.Text: Forced: When Forest Flies attacks, raise the defending player's threat by 1.
Forest Flies.Shadow: Shadow: Raise your threat by 1 for each enemy engaged with you.

The Spider's Web.Text: When Revealed: The player with the highest threat exhausts all heroes he controls. Then, attach this card to one of that player's heroes. (Counts as a condition attachment with the text, "Each time attached hero readies, deal it 1 damage.")

Backtrack!.Text: When Revealed: The topmost enemy or location card in the encounter discard pile is returned to the staging area.
Backtrack!.Shadow: Shadow: Deal and resolve the topmost Shadow effect in the encounter discard pile for this attack.

Glade of the Spawn.Text: When Glade of the Spawn is the active location, it gains: "Forced: After a Spider enemy enters play, each player must choose and exhaust 1 character he controls."

Journey Along the Anduin.Text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

Marshland Outlaws.Text: If you are engaged with this enemy, you cannot attack or deal damage (through effects) to enemies with a title other than Marshland Outlaws.
Marshland Outlaws.Shadow: Shadow: Raise your threat by X. X is the amount of damage dealt by this attack.

Anduin Troll Spawn.Text:
If there is no Hill Troll in play, Anduin Troll Spawn gains surge.

Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, Anduin Troll Spawn engages a player engaged with a Hill Troll.

Brown Water Rats.Keywords: Brown Water Rats cannot be damaged.
Brown Water Rats.Text: Forced: If the players are on stage 3 and all remaining enemies have the printed Rat trait, discard Brown Water Rats from play.
Brown Water Rats.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy cannot be damaged this round.

A Flooded Ford.Text: Each card revealed by the encounter deck gains doomed X. X is the number of progress tokens on this card.
A Flooded Ford.Shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, put A Flooded Ford into the staging area with 1 progress token on it.

Gladden Marshlands.Text: Action: Deal 1 damage to a hero you control to reduce Gladden Marshlands' $ by 1 until the end of the phase. Any player may trigger this effect.
Gladden Marshlands.Shadow: Shadow: Each enemy engaged with the defending character gets +1 Û until the end of the phase. (+2 Û instead if this attack is undefended.)

Pursuit on the Shore.Text: When Revealed: Search the victory display and encounter discard pile for the enemy with the most hit points. Return that enemy to the staging area. If no enemy is returned by this effect, Pursuit on the Shore gains surge. (Cannot be canceled.)

Troll Attack.Text: When Revealed: All engaged Troll enemies attack. If no Troll enemies are engaged, Troll Attack gains surge.
Troll Attack.Shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is a Troll, resolve this attack against each player. (Attack is undefended against each player not engaged with this enemy.)

Smoking Blood.Text: When Revealed: The opposing team attached Smoking Blood to a Troll enemy. If they cannot, Smoking Blood gains surge.(Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per enemy. Forced: When attached enemy is dealt enough damage to destroy it, cancel the damage and discard Smoking Blood instead.")

Escape from Dol Guldur.Text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

Torture Master.Text: When Revealed: Add 1 resource token to each Dol Guldur location in play.
Torture Master.Shadow: Shadow: Any hero damaged (but not defeated) by this attack is turned face down, as a "prisoner." Then, if the players are on stage 3, return to stage 2B of the quest.

Crazed Captive.Text: Forced: If Crazed Captive is defeated, raise each player's threat by 7.
Crazed Captive.Shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is not defeated this phase, raise defending player's threat by 7 at the end of the phase.

Spider of Dol Guldur.Text: Forced: After Spider of Dol Guldur attacks and destroys an ally, return it to the staging area.
Spider of Dol Guldur.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack against you after this one.

Torture Chamber.Text:
X is twice number of cards captured underneath Torture Chamber.
Forced: At the end of the combat phase, if Torture Chamber is in the staging area, deal 1 damage to each exhausted character.

Dungeon Labyrinth.Text:
Dungeon Labyrinth gets +1 $ and +1 quest point for each resource token on it.

Forced: At the end of each round, place 1 resource token on Dungeon Labyrinth for each player in the game.

Sentinel of Shadow.Text: When Revealed: The staging area gets +X $ until the end of the phase, where X is twice the number of players in the game. If the players quest unsuccessfully this phase, put the Nazul of Dol Guldur into play (from any out of play area), engaged with the first player. (Cannot be canceled.)

Catacomb Inspection.Text: When Revealed: Add 1 resource token to each Dol Guldur location in play.
Catacomb Inspection.Shadow: Shadow: If there is a Dol Guldur location in the staging area, move 1 resource token from each of your heroes' resource pools to that location. (Resolve this effect for each Dol Guldur location.

Dark Interrogation.Text: When Revealed: Each player must choose and discard cards from hand until he has only 2 cards in hand. (Each player with 2 or fewer cards in hand must instead reveal 1 card from the encounter deck.)
Dark Interrogation.Shadow: Shadow: Discard each card you control that has at least 1 copy of itself in your discard pile. (If this attack is undefended, each player must resolve this effect.)

The Hunt for Gollum.Text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

Ravenous Hawk.Text: Forced: When a card effect instructs a player to "look" at cards in the encounter deck and Ravenous Hawk is among those cards, that player must put Ravenous Hawk into play engaged with him. (This does not satisfy the Forced effect of stage 1B or 2B).

Hunting Warg.Text: Forced: After Hunting Warg engages a player, it makes an immediate attack. If Hunting Warg is dealt a shadow card with no shadow effect for this attack, it gets +2 Û until the end of the phase.

Watched Path.Text: Forced: When Watched Path is explored, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card is an enemy, add it to the staging area.

Hunter's Lookout.Text: While Hunter's Lookout is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: At the end of the round, raise each player's threat by 1 for each enemy in the staging area."Travel: The highest Û enemy in the staging area makes an immediate attack against the first player.

Dark Pools.Text:
Progress cannot be placed on Dark Pools while it is in the staging area.

Forced: After Dark Pools becomes the active location, each player must discard an ally with the highest printed cost among the allies he controls.

The Enemy's Trail.Text: When Revealed: Search the encounter discard pile for a Clue card and attach it to a Mordor enemy in play, if able. If no card is attached by this effect, The Enemy's Trail gains surge.
The Enemy's Trail.Shadow: Shadow: Search the encounter discard pile for a Clue card and attach it to a Mordor enemy in play, if able.

Restless Hunters.Text: When Revealed: Return each engaged enemy to the staging area. If no enemies were returned this way, Restless Hunters gains surge.
Restless Hunters.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack. If this attack destroys a character, return attacking enemy to the staging area.

The Trail Goes Cold.Text:
When Revealed: Attach to the active location and remove all progress from that location. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per location. Attached location contributes its $ during the quest phase as if it were in the staging area.")

If The Trail Goes Cold does not attach to a location as a result of its effect, it gains surge.

Conflict at the Carrock.Text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

Savage Hill-troll.Text: While Savage Hill-troll is in the victory display, each Troll enemy gets +1 hit point.
Savage Hill-troll.Shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is a Troll, defending character does not ready during the refresh phase this round.

Rob & Bob.Text: Forced: After Rob & Bob makes its first attack each round, if there are two or more players, it engages the next player and makes an additional attack (discard and deal a new shadow card for this attack).

Troll Lair.Text: While Troll Lair is in the staging area, players cannot reduce their threat.
Troll Lair.Shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is a Troll, remove 4 damage tokens from it.

Hives and Hives.Text: Forced: After any amount of progress is placed on Hives and Hives, deal 1 damage to each character in play.

Time for Supper.Text: When Revealed: The first player chooses a hero in any player's discard pile and removes that hero from the game. Then, heal all damage from each Troll enemy in play. If no damage is removed from any Troll enemy as a result of this effect, Time for Supper gains surge.

Grimbeorn's Folly.Text: When Revealed: Add Rob & Bob to the staging area. Then, each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a non-unique Troll enemy and add it to the staging area, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck.

A Journey to Rhosgobel.Text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

Goblin Eagle-hunter.Text:
Goblin Eagle-hunter gets +1 hit point per player.

Forced: At the end of the combat phase, deal 1 damage to Wilyador.
Goblin Eagle-hunter.Shadow: Shadow: If Wilyador has 10 or less damage on him, deal 2 damage to Wilyador.

Treetop Bird-eater.Text:
While Treetop Bird-eater is engaged with a player, characters controlled by that player cannot be healed.

Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, Treetop Bird-eater engages the player who controls Wilyador (regardless of threat).

Pitch-dark Thicket.Text: While Pitch-dark Thicket is in the staging area, enemies in the staging area cannot take damage.
Pitch-dark Thicket.Shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy was engaged this round, it cannot take damage until the end of the round.

Shot from the Sky.Text: When Revealed: Attach to an Eagle character. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per character. Attached character loses the Eagle trait, and takes 1 damage each time it readies.")
Shot from the Sky.Shadow: Shadow: Resolve the "when revealed" effect of Shot from the Sky.

Noxious Supplies.Text: When Revealed: Attach to Wilyador. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: When attached character is healed by a card effect other than Athelas, the amount of damage healed is reduced to 1. Then, discard Noxious Supplies.")

Tunneling Nameless Thing.Encounter Set: The Hills of Emyn Muil - Nightmare
Tunneling Nameless Thing.Text:
Forced: After the players travel to a location, Tunneling Nameless Thing engages the first player.

If there is no active location, return Tunneling Nameless Thing to the staging area.

Orc Interceptor.Encounter Set: The Hills of Emyn Muil - Nightmare
Orc Interceptor.Text:
Orc Interceptor gets +1 $ and +1 Û for each resource token on it.

Forced: After a location leaves play as an explored location, place a resource token on Orc Interceptor.

Brambles and Thorns.Encounter Set: The Hills of Emyn Muil - Nightmare
Brambles and Thorns.Text: Forced: After a character commits to the quest, deal 1 damage to that character if it has not been dealt damage by another copy of Brambles and Thorns this round.

Sarn Gebir Rapids.Encounter Set: The Hills of Emyn Muil - Nightmare
Sarn Gebir Rapids.Text: While Sarn Gebir Rapids is the active location, the "when revealed" effects of Hazard cards cannot be canceled.

A Hurrying Darkness.Encounter Set: The Hills of Emyn Muil - Nightmare
A Hurrying Darkness.Text: When Revealed: Each player must either increase his threat by 5, or reveal an additional encounter card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.
A Hurrying Darkness.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +X Û. X is the $ of the active location.

Blast of Savage Wind.Encounter Set: The Hills of Emyn Muil - Nightmare
Blast of Savage Wind.Text: When Revealed: Remove all progress from each Emyn Muil location in play. Each Eymn Muil location gets +2 $ until the end of the round.
Blast of Savage Wind.Shadow: Shadow: Remove all progress from each Emyn Muil location in play.

Hazardous Terrain.Encounter Set: The Hills of Emyn Muil - Nightmare
Hazardous Terrain.Text: When Revealed: Shuffle all Hazard cards in the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.
Hazardous Terrain.Shadow: Shadow: Shuffle all Hazard cards in the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck. Then, deal another shadow card for this attack.

Retraced Steps.Encounter Set: The Hills of Emyn Muil - Nightmare
Retraced Steps.Text: When Revealed: Discard a random Emyn Muil location from the victory display.

The Dead Marshes.Text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

The Mere of Dead Faces.Text:
X is the number of resource tokens here. Cannot leave the staging area.

If Gollum is not in play, any resource tokens that would be placed on Gollum are placed here instead.

Forced: After Gollum enters play, place 2 resource tokens on Gollum, then move all resource tokens from The Mere of Dead Faces to Gollum.

Stagnant Quagmire.Text:
While Stagnant Quagmire is in play, it adds its Escape value to all escape tests.

Escape: 2
Stagnant Quagmire.Shadow: Shadow: Perform an escape test, dealing 1 card from the encounter deck. If this test is failed, discard defending character.

Things in the Pools.Text: Forced: After a character commits to an escape test, deal 1 damage to that character.
Things in the Pools.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if attacking enemy is Undead).

Marsh-wight.Text: Forced: After Marsh-wight engages a player, that player makes an escape test, dealing 3 cards from the encounter deck. If this test is failed, place 2 resource tokens on Gollum and Marsh-wight make an immediate attack.

Lost Soul of L\u00f3rien.Text: Forced: After Lost Soul of Lórien is destroyed, attach it to a hero with 1 or more Ò, if able. (Counts as a condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero's Ò is reduced to 0.")

Ill-fated Guard.Text: While Ill-fated Guard is engaged with a player, that player cannot commit more than 1 character to each escape test.
Ill-fated Guard.Shadow: Shadow: Discard all attachments from each characater you control with 3 or more Ò.

Candles of Corpses.Text:
When Revealed: Each player makes an escape test, dealing 1 card from the encounter deck. Each player who fails this test must either discard a hero he controls from play or raise his threat by 5.

Escape: 5

Swarming Mosquitoes.Text: When Revealed: Each player deals X damage to a character he controls, where X is more than the stage number of the main quest.
Swarming Mosquitoes.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack (+2 Attack instead if the defending character has an attachment).

Devilry of the Dark Land.Text:
When Revealed: Return the top X Undead enemies in the encounter discard pile to the staging area, where X is the number of players. If no enemies were returned to the staging area as a result of this effect, Devilry of the Dark Land gains surge.

Escape: 10

Return to Mirkwood.Text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

Pursuing Warg-rider.Text: Forced: After the player guarding Gollum changes, Pursuing Warg-rider engages the player Guarding Gollum and makes an immediate attack against that player.

Deceptive Path.Text:
Progress cannot be placed on Deceptive Path while it is in the staging area.

Forced: After Deceptive Path becomes the active location, shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a location is discarded. Reveal that location and make it the active location. Then, discard Deceptive Path.

Web-wall.Text: When Revealed: Reveal the topmost Spider enemy in the encounter discard pile and add it to the staging area.
Web-wall.Shadow: Shadow: The player guarding Gollum must discard all resources from each of his heroes' resource pools.

Isolation.Text: When Revealed: Attach Isolation to the current quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "All characters lose the ranged and sentinel keywords. The player guarding Gollum cannot choose a new player to guard Gollum.")

Befouled Equipment.Text: When Revealed: Û to the character with the most attachments without Befouled Equipment attached. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: At the end of the round, discard an attachment from attached character. Befouled Equipment cannot be discarded this way unless it is the only attachment on attached character.")

Wickedness and Mischief.Text: When Revealed: The player guarding Gollum must either reveal the topmost Tantrum card in the encounter discard pile, or reveal 2 additional encounter cards from the encounter deck.
Wickedness and Mischief.Shadow: Shadow: Deal the topmost Tantrum card in the encounter discard pile as a new shadow card for this attack, if able.

Trouble with Trolls.Text: Remove the following cards from the encounter deck: 2 Hobbit-lands; 2 A Nice Pickle; More like a Grocer; Troll Cave; Troll Purse; and the 7 Sack cards. Add only the enemy cards from the Wilderlands and Seventh Level encounter sets to the encounter deck and shuffle it. Shuffle the 7 Sack cards face down to form a Sack deck.

Rebuild the Defenses.Text: Setup: Set Lieutenant of Angmar, Battering Ram, Enemy Camp, Siege Tunnel, each copy of Host of Angmar, and each copy Dúnedain of Annúminas aside, out of play. Each player searches the encounter deck for a different location and adds it to the staging area. One of those locations must be Gate of Annúminas. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Defend the City.Text: When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until X enemies are discarded. X is one less than the number of players at this stage, to a minimum of 1. Add each enemy discarded in this way to the staging area.

Lead a Sortie.Text: When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. The first player adds Battering Ram and Lieutenant of Angmar to the staging area. Each other player reveals an encounter card.

Raise the Levee.Text: Setup: Set Lieutenant of Angmar, Battering Ram, Enemy Camp, Siege Tunnel, each copy of Host of Angmar, and each copy Dúnedain of Annúminas aside, out of play. Shuffle the encounter deck. Each player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until he discards an enemy or location. Add each enemy and location discarded in this way to the staging area.

Guard the Gate.Text: When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until X enemies are discarded. X is one less than the number of players at this stage, to a minimum of 1. Add each enemy discarded in this way to the staging area.

Man the Walls.Text: Play only if no other copies of Man the Walls have been played this round. Planning Action: Reduce the cost of the first ally played by each player this phase by 1. Those allies cannot quest this round.

Stop the Attack.Text: When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. The first player adds Siege Tunnel to the staging area. Each other player reveals an encounter card.

Ann\u00faminas.Text:
Forced: At the end of the round, deal 1 damage to Annúminas for each enemy at each stage.

If the city strength of Annúminas reaches 0, the city is overrun by the forces of Angmar and all teams lose the game.

Lieutenant of Angmar.Text:
Lieutenant of Angmar cannot take damage unless there is at least 10 progress on the main quest.

Forced: At the end of the round, Lieutenant of Angmar moves to the staging area with the lowest total $ and makes an immediate attack against the first player.

Enemy Camp.Text:
Forced: At the end of the round, if Enemy Camp is in play, discard 1 random facedown hero from under each stage 3. If Enemy Camp is in the victory display, return each hero under each stage 3 to its owner's control instead.

Travel: Reveal 1 encounter card per player to travel here.

Siege Tunnel.Text:
Forced: At the end or the round, each team discards cards from the top of their encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and adds that enemy to their staging area.

Travel: Reveal 1 encounter card per player to travel here.

Host of Angmar.Keywords:
Archery 2.

Immune to player card effects.
Host of Angmar.Text: Forced: After Host of Angmar attacks and destroys a character, either remove 2 progress from the main quest, or return Host of Angmar to the staging area.

D\u00fanedain of Ann\u00faminas.Text: When Revealed: Any player may spend 1 resource to take control of Dúnedain of Annúminas. Otherwise, discard it.
D\u00fanedain of Ann\u00faminas.Shadow: Shadow: Ready the defending character and give it +2 Ú for this attack.

Gate of Ann\u00faminas.Text:
X is 1 more than the number of enemies in play.

Travel: Each player engages an enemy in the staging area to travel here.

Arnor Battlefield.Text:
While Arnor Battlefield is in the staging area, each non-unique enemy gets -5 engagement cost.

Travel: Each player deals 1 damage to a hero he controls to travel here.

Hills of Evendim.Text:
While Hills of Evendim is in the staging area, 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled.

Travel: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until an enemy is discarded. Add the discarded enemy to the staging area to travel here.

Shores of Lake Nenuial.Text:
While Shores of Lake Nenuial is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on other locations in the staging area.

Travel: Raise each player's threat by 2 to travel here.

Warg of Carn D\u00fbm.Text: Forced: After Warg of Carn Dûm engages you, either remove 1 progress from the main quest, or exhaust a charater you control.

Orc of Angmar.Text: Forced: When Orc of Angmar attacks, either remove 1 progress from the main quest, or it gets +2 Ú until the end of the phase.
Orc of Angmar.Shadow: Shadow: Defender gets -2 Ú until the end of the round.

Angmar Warg-rider.Text: Forced: After Angmar Warg-rider engages you, either remove 2 progress from the main quest, or it makes an immediate attack.
Angmar Warg-rider.Shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control.

Vanguard of Carn D\u00fbm.Text: While Vanguard of Carn Dûm is in the staging area, no more than 5 progress can be placed on the main quest each round.
Vanguard of Carn D\u00fbm.Shadow: Shadow: Defender cannot ready this round.

The Hordes of Angmar.Text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either return the highest $ enemy engaged with you to the staging area, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and put it into play engaged with you.
The Hordes of Angmar.Shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, reveal the top card of the encounter deck.

Sorcery of Carn D\u00fbm.Text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either discard the highest cost attachment you control, or assign X damage among characters you control, where X is the number of attachments you control.
Sorcery of Carn D\u00fbm.Shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment you control.

Caught in the Press.Text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either deal 1 damage to each questing character you control or each questing character you control gets -1 Ò until the end of the phase.
Caught in the Press.Shadow: Shadow: Either remove 2 progress from the main quest, or return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

Weary Warriors.Text: When Revealed: Each player deals 1 damage to a hero he controls. If that hero is questing, remove it from the quest. Until the end of the round, treat each damaged character's text box as if it were blank (except for Traits).
Weary Warriors.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets + 1 Û (+2 Û instead if the defender is damaged).

Abominable Goblin.Text: Forced: If a shadow card with shadow effect has not been dealt to the first attacking Orc enemy engaged with a player during combat phase, deal that enemy an aditional shadow card until dealing him a shadow card with an effect.

Atrocious Beast.Keywords: Surge. Immune to player card effects.
Atrocious Beast.Shadow: Shadow: Deal X shadow cards to this attacker. X is the number of Dark Forest locations in play.

Dark Wolves.Text: If Dark Wolves is dealt a shadow card with effect, deal Dark Wolves an additional shadow card.
Dark Wolves.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. Deal it another shadow card.

Dol Guldur Explorers.Text: While there is an Orc enemy engaged with a player, event cards cost 1 additional matching resource to play from that player's hand.
Dol Guldur Explorers.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û and +1 Ú.

Hunter.Text: If there is an Orc enemy in the staging area, Hunter gets +2 Û and +2 Ú.
Hunter.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û and +1 Ú.

Marauder of the Hills.Keywords: Archery X. X is the number of allies in play.
Marauder of the Hills.Text: Forced: Ir Marauder of the Hills damages a character, that character's controller must choose and discard an attachment he controls.

Orc Patrol.Text: When revealed: Return each engaged Orc enemy in play to the staging area. Orc Patrol cannot leave the game while there is other Orc enemy in play that is not another copy of Orc Patrol.

Ranger Attacker.Keywords: Archery X. X is the number of Orc enemies in the staging are.
Ranger Attacker.Text: When Revealed: Each player deals 1 damage to a character he controls for each Orc enemy engaged with him.

Rock Mercenaries.Text: X is the number of players in the game. While there is a Mountain or Wasteland location in the staging area, Rock Mercenaries cannot engage or be engaged.

Seekers of Prey.Text: While Seekers of Prey is in the staging area, each Wild enemy gets +1 Û, +1 Ú and +1 Ò

Skilled Fighter.Keywords: Skilled Fighter gets -1 Ú for each resource token on him.
Skilled Fighter.Text: Forced: After an attack against Skilled Fighter is resolved, place 1 resource token on him for each character that participated in that attack.

Swift Riders.Text: If there is an Orc enemy engaged with the first player, Swift Riders engages that player.
Swift Riders.Shadow: Shadow: After this attack resolves, attacking enemy engages the next player, if able.

Abrupt Undergrowth.Keywords: Hunt X. X is double of the number of players in the game.
Abrupt Undergrowth.Text: Response: After traveling to Abrupt Undergrowth, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location.

Beorning Stream.Keywords: Hunt X. X is the number the first player decides.
Beorning Stream.Text: Response: After traveling to Beorning Stream, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location.

Cache.Keywords: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.
Cache.Text: Response: After traveling to Cache, the first player may choose up 2 Creature enemies in play. Discard the chosen enemies.

Carrock Road.Keywords: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.
Carrock Road.Text: Response: After traveling to Carrock Road, the first player may choose a location from the staging area and discard it, or draw 2 cards.

Dark Forest Peaks.Keywords: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.
Dark Forest Peaks.Shadow: Shadow: Defending player must discard 1 ally card from his hand, if able.

East Path.Keywords: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.
East Path.Text: Response: After traveling to East Path, the first player may choose a location from the staging area and discard it, or add 1 resource to each of his heroes' resource pool.

Inhospitable Places.Text: Response: After traveling to Inhospitable Places, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location. Forced: After traveling to Inhospitable Places, search encounter deck for 1 Creature enemy (2 Creature enemies if 3 or more players in the game), and add it to the staging area. Then, shuffle the encounter deck.

Mysterious Cave.Text: Response: After Mysterious Cave leaves play as an explored location, each player may search the top 5 cards of his deck for 1 card and add it to his hand. Shuffle the rest of the searched cards back into their owners' decks.

Old Pathway.Keywords: Hunt X. X is 1 (or 2 instead if there are 3 or more players in the game).
Old Pathway.Text: Response: After traveling to Old Pathway, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location.

Orc Camp.Text: When Revealed: Discard 1 card from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, and add it to the staging area.

Orc Camping.Text: When Revealed: Each player removes 1 resource from one of his hero's resource pools, if able.

South Settling.Text: When Revealed: Discard all allies in play. This effect cannot be canceled.

South Wilderlands.Text: Each Orc enemy gains Archery 1. Forced: After traveling to South Wilderlands, discard the top card of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, and add it to the staging area.
South Wilderlands.Shadow: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by 2.

The Gorge.Text: Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, discard the top card of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, and add it to the staging area.
The Gorge.Shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to a character controlled by the defending player.

The Thicket.Keywords: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.
The Thicket.Text: When Revealed: Each Dark Forest location in the staging area gets +1 $ until the end of the phase.
The Thicket.Shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment from the defending player.

Archaic Find.Text: When Revealed: Attach this card to the hero with the most progress tokens. Search the encounter deck and encounter discard pile for all copies of Archaic Find, and remove them from the game. Then shuffle the encounter deck. This effect cannot be canceled. Response: After a hero is damaged, cancel the damage and remove all progress tokens from attached hero. Limit once per game.

The Trial of the Dark Forest.Text: Setup: Remove and shuffle the Wild enemies into a Orcs from Dark Forest deck and set it aside face down. Then, shuffle the encounter deck. Each player reveals 1 card from the top of the encounter deck and adds it to the staging area.

Clarion Call.Text: When Revealed: At the beginning of the next encounter phase, discard a card from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck and add it to the staging area until there is X enemies in play. X is double or more of the number of players in game. This effect cannot be canceled.

Confusing Guidance.Text: When Revealed: Attach this card to any hero with the Ranged keyword without a copy of Confusing Guidance attached. Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: 'The attached hero cannot attack enemies engaged with other players'. If Confusing Guidance has not been attached to any hero, it gains Surge.

Night Looms.Text: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, players cannot declare more than 1 attacker agains one target enemy.
Night Looms.Shadow: Shadow: Attacker enemy cannot be declared as target of any attack until the end of the phase.

Remain Hidden.Text: When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a Camp location is discarded. Reveal and add the Camp location to the staging area. After reveal 1 card from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck and add it to the staging area.

Rising Storm.Text: When Revealed: Each player must remove 2 progress tokens from 1 hero he controls or exhaust 1 hero he controls. Then, remove 1 progress token from the quest card for each exhausted hero in play.
Rising Storm.Shadow: Shadow: Remove 1 progress token of any hero the defending player controls.

Terrifying Loneliness.Text: When Revealed: Each player must discard 1 attachment he controls and remove 1 progress token from any hero he controls, if able.
Terrifying Loneliness.Shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment from the defending character.

Unwelcome Allies.Text: When Revealed: Return all Wild enemies in play to the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, then shuffle the Orcs of Dark Forest deck. Then, discard X cards from the encounter deck and add them to the staging area. X is the number of enemies moved by this effect. Any player may remove 1 progress token from one hero he controls to reduce the X number by 1.

Fellowship With The Outlaws.Text:
Forced: After the 3rd Dilemma objective is added to the victory display, advance to stage 2A and remove Fellowship With The Outlaws from the game.

Forced: After the players quest unsuccessfully, reveal the top card of the dilemma deck.

If there are 7 cards in the dilemma deck discard pile, the players lose the game.

Forweg.Text:
The first player gains control of Forweg.

Forced: Forweg declares and resolves an attack against a random Woodmen enemy engaged with the first player at the end of the combat phase.

If Forweg leaves play, the players lose the game.

Androg.Text:
The first player gains control of Androg.

Each Woodmen enemy gets -5 engagement cost for each Corruption on heroes the first player controls.

If Androg leaves play, the players lose the game.

Larnach's Daughter.Text: When Revealed: Forweg declares an attack on Larnach's Daughter. The first player may declare an eligible defender against this attack. If no character is destroyed by this attack, add Larnach's Daughter to the victory display. If no defender is declared, each player deals 3 Corruption among characters he controls.

Cull the Weak.Text: When Revealed: Either each player must discard the character he controls with the fewest hit points to remove all damage from one character he controls, or add Cull the Weak to the victory display and each player must deal 3 damage to a hero he controls.

Punish The Trespassers.Text: When Revealed: Either each player must exhaust a character he controls to discard a Woodmen enemy from play, or add Punish The Trespassers to the victory display and each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Woodmen enemy and put it into play engaged with him. One of these must be Hound of the Woodmen, if able.

Raid The Homestead.Text: When Revealed: Either each player deals X Corruption to a hero he controls to add X resources to that hero's resource pool, or add Raid The Homestead to the victory display and discard all resources from play (any hero that does not discard a resource takes 2 damage).

Turn A Blind Eye.Text: When Revealed: Either each player must deal 1 Corruption to a hero he controls to reduce his threat by 3, or add Turn A Blind Eye to the victory display and exhaust all heroes in play.

Teiglin Hunter.Text: While Teiglin Hunter is engaged with a player, all enemies engaged with that player get +1 Û.
Teiglin Hunter.Shadow: Shadow: All enemies engaged with the defending player get +1 Û until the end of the phase.

Hound of the Woodmen.Text: Forced: At the start of the encounter phase, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Add that enemy to the staging area. This ability does not stack with other copies of Hound of the Woodmen.

Homestead Defender.Text: While Homestead Defender is engaged with a player, Woodmen enemies engaged with that player not named Homestead Defender cannot be attacked by non-objective characters.
Homestead Defender.Shadow: Shadow: All enemies engaged with the defending player get +2 Ú until the end of the phase.

Desperate Outlaw.Text: Forced: After an attack against Desperate Outlaw resolves, Desperate Outlaw makes an immediate attack against the defending player.
Desperate Outlaw.Shadow: Shadow: The attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

Cruel Robber.Text: Forced: After Cruel Robber attacks, discard 1 attachment the defending player controls.
Cruel Robber.Shadow: Shadow: Discard 1 attachment from the defending character.

Driven Outcast.Text: Forced: After Driven Outcast attacks, deal 1 damage to the defending character.
Driven Outcast.Shadow: Shadow: After this attack resolves, deal 1 damage to the defending character.

Scattered Homestead.Text: While Scattered Homestead is in the staging area, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck at the end of the round until an enemy is discarded. Add that enemy to the staging area.

Tilled Field.Text:
(Stage 1B) Response: After Tilled Field is explored, add 1 resource to each hero's resource pool.

(Stage 2B) When Revealed: Each player must exhaust a hero he controls.

Hedge and Stockade.Text:
(Stage 1B): While Hedge and Stockade is the active location, all Woodmen enemies get +2 Ú and 0 engagement cost.

(Stage 2B): While Hedge and Stockade is the active location, all Gaurwaith enemies get -1 Û and 0 engagement cost.

Woods of Teiglin.Text:
(Stage 1B) Response: After Woods of Teiglin is explored, each player draws 1 card.

(Stage 2B): While Woods of Teiglin is in the staging area, all Gaurwaith enemies get +1 $, +1 Û, and +1 Ú.

Dogs and Fences.Text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: Either deal X damage among heroes he controls, where X is equal to the number of engaged Woodmen enemies plus 2, or treat the printed text box of each non-objective character he controls as if it were blank, except for keywords and Traits, until the end of the round.

Horn-calls.Text: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Woodmen enemy and put it into play engaged with him. Then, each engaged Woodmen enemy makes an immediate attack.

No Law But Their Needs.Text: When Revealed: Either Either each player must immediately exhaust and commit 1 hero to the quest, or raise each player's threat by 4.
No Law But Their Needs.Shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy. If that enemy is destroyed, deal 1 Corruption to the defending character.

Wolf-men of the Winter.Text: When Revealed: Each player engaged with a Gaurwaith enemy must discard all resources he controls. If a player did not discard at least 3 resources, deal 1 damage to each character he controls.
Wolf-men of the Winter.Shadow: Shadow: The defending player must pay 1 resource or the attacking enemy gets +3 Û.

Banded Attack.Text: When Revealed: Each player deals X damage among characters he controls,  where X is the number of Gaurwaith enemies engaged with that player.
Banded Attack.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1Û for each enemy engaged with the defending player.

Blood Upon the Grass.Text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: Either raise his threat by 1 for each Corruption on characters he controls, or choose one character with at least 1 Corruption. That character is immediately corrupted.
Blood Upon the Grass.Shadow: Shadow: Exhaust all characters the defending player controls with at least 1 Corruption.

Cruel of Heart.Text: When Revealed: Attach to the hero with Curse of Morgoth attached. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: After an ally enters play, exhaust attached hero to deal 1 damage to that ally.")

Bitterness of Exile.Text: When Revealed: Remove each character with at least 1 Corruption from the quest.
Bitterness of Exile.Shadow: Shadow: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck. If it is an enemy or location, add it to the staging area.

Craft In Wood And Field.Text:
Attach to the hero with Curse of Morgoth attached.

Response: After the players travel to a location, choose a player and exhaust attached hero to reduce that player's threat by the $ of the active location.

Hardship of the Wild.Text:
Setup: Attach to a hero.

Attached hero gets +1 Ú and +1 hit point.

Response: Add Hardship of the Wild to the victory display, and remove it from the campaign pool, to cancel 2 points of damage just dealt to attached hero.

An Evil and Dangerous Way.Text: Setup: Set all enemy and treachery cards with the Gaurwaith trait aside, out of play. Shuffle all Dilemma cards together into a dilemma deck. Add Fellowship with the Outlaws to the staging area. Put Forweg and Androg into play, ally side faceup. Each player searches the encounter deck for a different location and adds it to the staging area.

To Govern this Fellowship.Text: When Revealed: Flip Forweg and Androg to their enemy sides, remove all tokens from them, and place them in the staging area. Discard all Woodmen enemies. Remove all enemy and treachery cards with the Woodmen trait from the encounter deck and discard pile and set them aside, out of play. Shuffle the set aside enemy and treachery cards with the Gaurwaith trait into the encounter deck. Reveal 1 encounter card per player.

Among The Outlaws.Text:
You are playing Campaign Mode.

Response: Discard the top card of the dilemma deck to cancel the "when revealed" effects of a card that was just revealed from the encounter deck. (Limit once per game.)

B\u00f3r the Faithful.Text: Action: Discard 1 Corruption from Bór the Faithful to ready him. He gets +2 Û and +1 Ò until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

Elder of the Realm.Text: Response: After a treachery card is revealed, discard a card from hand (spend 1 Î to discard the top card of your deck instead). If the first letter of the treachery card's title matches that of the discarded card, cancel the "when revealed" effects of the revealed card. (Limit once per game.)

Brethil Hound.Text: Response: After Brethil Hound participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, choose a player. That player reduces his threat by 1. (Limit once per phase.)

Algund.Text: Response: When the discard pile is shuffled back into the encounter deck, deal X Corruption to Algund to choose X cards in the discard pile. These cards are not shuffled back into the encounter deck.

Fostered Son.Text: Action: Discard Fostered Son to reduce the cost of the next unique Edain character you play this phase by 2.

Wolf-man.Text: Action: Exhaust Wolf-man to immediately declare him as an attacker (and resolve his attack) against an engaged enemy with one hit point remaining.

Neithan.Text:
Attach to Túrin Turambar. Limit 1 Name in play.

Resources on Neithan can be discarded to satisfy the ransom keyword.

Response: When an enemy with the ransom keyword is defeated, add 2 resources to Neithan.

Forge of Belegost.Text:
Attach to a Dwarf character.

Action: Exhaust Forge of Belegost and attached character to heal X damage on a character. X is the number of Item attachments on that character.

Angrist.Text:
Attach to a Dwarf character.

Action: Exhaust Forge of Belegost and attached character to heal X damage on a character. X is the number of Item attachments on that character.

None Shall Break.Text: Action: Ready each character with an Oath attached. (Lower the cost of None Shall Break by 2 if each character that readies takes 1 Corruption.)

Song of Parting.Text: Response: After an encounter card with at least 3 $ is revealed from the encounter deck, choose and ready a character. That character gets +2 Ò, +2 Û, and +2 Ú until the end of the round.

Sauron.Encounter Set: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
Sauron.Keywords: Immune to player card effects. Cannot take damage.
Sauron.Text: Sauron cannot leave the staging area, and is considered to be engaged with each player. Forced: After Sauron attacks, the defending player must discard 2 characters if possible.

Elven Alliance.Encounter Set: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
Elven Alliance.Text: When revealed: The first player attaches this card to a hero of his choice as an attachment. Action: If another player controls Narsil, exhaust Elven Alliance to attach Narsil to one of your Gondor heroes.

Human Alliance.Encounter Set: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
Human Alliance.Text: When revealed: The first player attaches this card to a hero of his choice as an attachment. Attached hero gains Gondor trait.

Narsil.Encounter Set: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
Narsil.Keywords: Narsil can only be attached to a Gondor hero.
Narsil.Text: Action: Discard X cards from hand to reduce Sauron’s Ú by X until the end of the phase. Action: If the players control Elven Alliance and Human Alliance add Narsil to the victory display to place 1 resource token on Sauron.

Combat.Encounter Set: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance

Terrible and Unstoppable.Encounter Set: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
Terrible and Unstoppable.Text: When revealed: Discard all enemies from play then add Sauron to the staging area. Any player may discard a Noldor hero and put Narsil into play, attached to a Gondor hero they control. Advance to the refresh phase.

The Wastes of Eriador.Text:
Begin with the standard quest deck and encounter deck for The Wastes of Eriador scenario.
Remove the following cards, in the specified quantities, from the standard encounter deck:
2x Northern Warg
1x White Warg
1x Sudden Darkness
1x North Downs
2x Eriador Wastes
1x Cold from Angmar
3x Biting Wind
1x Freezing Blast
1x Shrouded Hills
3x Rugged Country
2x Pressing Needs
Then, shuffle the encounter cards in this Nightmare Deck into the remainder of the standard The Wastes of Eriador encounter deck.
Finally, flip this setup card over and place it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

Pack Hunters.Text:
While it is Night, Pack Hunters gets -30 engagement cost.
Forced: When you engage Pack Hunters, search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a Warg enemy, and put it into play engaged with you (top 10 cards instead if it is Night). Shuffle the encounter deck.

Shrouded Wilderness.Text:
While it is Night, progress cannot be placed on Shrouded Wilderness.
Travel: Flip the Time objective from Daybreak to Nightfall.
Shrouded Wilderness.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. Then, if it is Night, deal attacking enemy another shadow card.

Snowy Badlands.Text:
While Snow Badlands is in the staging area, each enemy in the staging area cannot take damage.
Travel: Each player deals 1 damage to an exhausted character he controls to travel here (2 damage instead if it is Night).

Cunning Wolves.Text: When Revealed: Attach to the current quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Attached quest gets +3 quest points. Each Warg enemy cannot be optionally engaged.")
Cunning Wolves.Shadow: Shadow: If it is Night, deal attacking enemy 2 additional shadow cards.

Torrent of Hail.Text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each questing character. If it is Night, discard an attachment from each character damaged by this effect.
Torrent of Hail.Shadow: Shadow: Discard 1 attachment you control (2 attachments instead if it is Night).

Make a Stand.Text:
When Revealed: If it is Day, flip the Time objective to Nightfall.
The Time objective cannot flip to Daybreak.
Response: After an enemy is defeated, place 1 resource token on Make a Stand. Then, if there are 2 resource tokens per player on Make a Stand, or if there are no enemies in play, add Make a Stand to the victory display.

Forced off Track.Text:
Forced: At the end of the round, remove X progress from the main quest, where X is the number of Warg enemies in play.
Response: When this quest is defeated, discard a non-unique Warg enemy in the staging area.

Jailor Gornakh.Text:
Forced: After Jailor Gornakh enters play, each player searches his captured deck for each hero and captures them underneath Jailor Gornakh.
Forced: After a player rescues any number of cards, Jailor Gornakh attacks that player.

Cruel Torment.Text: When Revealed: Attach to the current quest. Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Each player cannot have more than 6 cards in his hand. (Each player with more than 6 cards in his hand must immediately discard cards until he has 6 cards in his hand.)"

Raid Golfimbul's Vault.Text:
Forced: After a card is captured by another card effect, capture a random card from each player's hand underneath Raid Golfimbul's Vault.
Forced: When the captured cards underneath Raid Golfimbul's Vault are rescued, put each rescued Item card into its owner's hand and discard the rest.

Orc of Thaurdir.Text: Forced: When Orc of Thaurdir attacks you, either discard the top 2 cards of your captured deck, or deal Orc of Thaurdir 2 additional shadow cards.
Orc of Thaurdir.Shadow: Shadow: For each damage dealt by this attack discard the top card of your captured deck.

Hoarwell River Serpent.Text:
As an additional cost to travel to a safe location, one player must engage Hoarwell River Serpent.
Forced: When you engage Hoarwell River Serpent, deal 1 damage to each damaged character you control.

Scavenging Stone-troll.Text:
You cannot travel to a safe location while Scavenging Stone-troll has no damage on it.
While Scavenging Stone-troll is in the staging area, cards in each player's discard pile cannot leave the discard pile.

Giant Beetle.Text:
While Giant Beetle is engaged with a player, it gains: "As an additional cost to travel to a safe location, Giant Beetle makes an immediate attack against the engaged player."
Damaged characters cannot be declared as attackers or defenders against Giant Beetle.

Rocky Foothills.Text:
When faced with the option to travel, the players must travel to Rocky Foothills, if able.
Rocky Foothills gets +2 quest points for each quest in play.
Rocky Foothills.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each damage on the defending character.

Vast Troll-fells.Text:
As an additional cost to travel to a safe location, each player must spend 1 resource.
Heroes cannot gain resources by card effects.
Vast Troll-fells.Shadow: Shadow: If no progress was placed on a side quest this round, attacking enemy gets +4 Û.

Crashing Thunder.Text: When Revealed: Each player assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is the number of quests in play. Exhaust each damaged character in play.
Crashing Thunder.Shadow: Shadow: Shuffle each Weather card from the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

Barren and Desolate.Text: When Revealed: Attach to a side quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per quest. While attached quest is the current quest, each character gets -1 Ò.")

Isolated.Text:
Caught in a dense fog, you suddenly find yourself separated from your companions.
Surge. Players cannot draw cards by card effects.
Forced: When this stage is defeated, each player draws 1 card.

When Revealed: Each player places the lowest-threat-cost hero he controls facedown underneath Rescue from the Trolls, out of play.
Response: After a Troll enemy is destroyed, place 3 progress on Rescue from the Trolls.
Forced: When Rescue from the Trolls is defeated, each player takes control of each of his heroes underneath it.

Thaurdir's Hunter.Text: Forced: When Thaurdir's Hunter attacks, either remove 1 time counter from the main quest, or treat this attack as undefended.

Undead Thrall.Shadow: Shadow: Put Undead Thrall into play engaged with the defending player and deal it a shadow card.

Forgotten CourtYard.Text:
Forgotten Courtyard gets +1 $ for each resource on it.
Forced: After an Undead enemy enters play, place 1 resource on Forgotten Courtyard.

Charred Cellar.Text: While Charred Cellar is the active location, it gains: "Forced: After a player's threat is increased by an encounter card effect, that player must deal 2 damage to a character he controls."

Malevolent Forces.Text: When Revealed: Remove the questing character with the highest Ò from the quest. The player who controls that character raises his threat by an amount equal to that character's Ò.

Apostate of Angmar.Text: While you are engaged with Apostate of Angmar, you cannot attack Thaurdir.

Immune to player card effects.

Life Drain.Text: Deal Life Drain to Thaurdir, as a shadow card.
Life Drain.Shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is Thaurdir, he gets +3 Û. If this attack destroys a character, attach Life Drain to Thaurdir. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Thaurdir gets +3 hit points.")

Orc Wight.Encounter Set: The Battle of Carn Dûm - Nightmare
Orc Wight.Text: Forced: After Orc Wight enters play, deal it 2 shadow cards.
Orc Wight.Shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy has at least 1 other shadow card currently dealt to it, return it to the staging area after this attack.

Thaurdir's Elite.Encounter Set: The Battle of Carn Dûm - Nightmare
Thaurdir's Elite.Text: Forced: If there are 3 shadow cards dealt to Thaurdir's Elite, discard all shadow cards dealt to it and each player must discard an ally he controls.
Thaurdir's Elite.Shadow: Shadow: Either raise your threat by 4, or discard an ally you control.

Stronghold Tower.Encounter Set: The Battle of Carn Dûm - Nightmare
Stronghold Tower.Text:
While Stronghold Tower is in the staging area, shadow effects cannot be canceled.

Gates of Carn D\u00fbm.Encounter Set: The Battle of Carn Dûm - Nightmare
Gates of Carn D\u00fbm.Text: Forced: After Gates of Carn Dûm is explored, deal it as shadow card to the enemy in the staging area with the lowest engagement cost.
Gates of Carn D\u00fbm.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û and cannot take damage this round.

Death and Decay.Encounter Set: The Battle of Carn Dûm - Nightmare
Death and Decay.Text: When Revealed: Discard the top 3 cards of each player's deck. Each player discards each attachment he controls that has the same title as a card in his discard pile. If no attachments are discarded from play by this effect, Death and Decay gains surge.

Howling of Wargs.Encounter Set: The Battle of Carn Dûm - Nightmare
Howling of Wargs.Text: When Revealed: Either deal 1 shadow card to each enemy in the staging area, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for a side quest and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck if it is searched.
