Black Mare.Encounter Set: The Battle of Carn Dûm - Nightmare
Black Mare.Text: When Revealed: Attach to Thaurdir. (Counts as a Mount attachment with the text: "Black Mare remains attached even if Thaurdir flips. Thaurdir gets +3 hit points. Forced: After Thaurdir is flipped, raise each player's threat by 1.")
Black Mare.Shadow: Shadow: Attach Black Mare to Thaurdir.

Protect the Flanks.Encounter Set: The Battle of Carn Dûm - Nightmare
Protect the Flanks.Text: Forced: At the end of the combat phase, assign X damage among characters in play, where X is the total number of shadow cards dealt to enemies in the staging area.

Rally the Fighters.Encounter Set: The Battle of Carn Dûm - Nightmare
Rally the Fighters.Text:
Your task seems hopeless and your fate dire, but somehow you must inspire your companions to fight onward!
Shadow cards are immune to player card effects.
Response: After this quest is defeated, discard 1 shadow card from each enemy in play.

Sever the Head.Encounter Set: The Battle of Carn Dûm - Nightmare
Sever the Head.Text:
Your adversary Thaurdir will not let you interrupt his master's ritual. Only by fighting through his ranks of Orcs can you hope to do battle with the wraith himself.
Thaurdir gets +2 $, +2 Û, and cannot take damage.

Silent Guardian.Text: While you are engaged with Silent Guardian it gains: "Forced: The first time you play an event card each round, instead of discarding that card after playing it, reanimate it."

Necromancer of Carn D\u00fbm.Text: Forced: When Necromancer of Carn Dûm would attack you, instead reanimate the top card of your deck and deal it each of the Necromancer of Carn Dûm's shadow cards.

Inner Sanctum.Text:
Progress cannot be placed on Inner Sanctum while it is in the staging area.
Travel: Discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Resolve the 'when revealed' effects of each Sorcery card discarded by this effect.

Cursed Halls.Text: While Cursed Halls is in the staging area, Sorcery attachments are immune to player card effects.
Cursed Halls.Shadow: Shadow: Until the end of the phase, attacking enemy gets +1 Û and +1 Ú for each Reanimated Dead engaged with you.

Power Beyond Death.Text: When Revealed: Attach to the main quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Daechanar gets +2 Ú.")
Power Beyond Death.Shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, resolve this card's 'when revealed' effect.

Daechannar's Curse.Text: When Revealed: Attach Daechanar's Curse to the top of the first player's deck. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "The next time a player would draw 1 or more cards from attached deck, reanimate those cards instead. Then, discard Daechanar's Curse.")

All is Lost.Text: When Revealed: Attach All is Lost to the first player's threat dial. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Each time you attack a Reanimated Dead, raise your threat by 1.")
All is Lost.Shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is a Reanimated Dead, it attacks again after this attack.

The Witch-King's Gift.Text:
Daechanar is powerful in the art of necromancy. His army will not rest until you join them in death.
Time 5. Forced: When the last time counter is removed from this quest, reanimate each card in each player's discard pile. Then, remove the Witch-king's Gift from the game.
When this quest is defeated, place it in the encounter discard pile.

Dain Ironfoot.Text: While Dain Ironfoot is defending, he gains: “Action: Discard the top card of your deck to give Dain Ironfoot +1 Ú for this attack. (Limit 3 times per phase.)”

Soldier of Erebor.Text: Action: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck to ready Soldier of Erebor. (Limit once per round.)

Mirkwood Hunter.Text: Reduce the cost to play Mirkwood Hunter by 1 for each attachment on the active location.

Warrior Sword.Text: Attach to a Ï or Warrior character. Restricted. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gets +1 Û for each enemy engaged with you. (Limit +3 Û.)

Swift and Strong.Text: Response: After a character you control attacks and destroys an enemy, exhaust a Weapon attached to that character to ready that character and give it +2 Û for its next attack this phase.

Descendant of Girion.Text: Reduce the cost to play Item attachments on Descendant of Girion by 1.

Valiant Determination.Text: Attach to an ally. Attached ally does not exhaust to quest.

Ring of Thror.Text: Guarded (enemy or location). Attach to a Dwarf hero.  Action: Exhaust Ring of Thror and discard the top card of your deck to ready attached hero. If the discarded card is an attachment, put it into play.

Crypt Key.Text: If unattached, the first player claims Crypt Key and attaches it to a hero he controls. Response: When the players travel to a Discover location, exhaust Crypt Key to either increase or decrease its Discover value by 1 before resolving it.

Old Lantern.Text: If unattached, the first player claims Old Lantern and attaches it to a hero he controls. Action: Exhaust Old Lantern to choose a player to look at the top X cards of his deck, where X is the Discover value of the active location. He adds one of those cards to his hand and places the rest on the bottom of his deck.

Scatha\u2019s Teeth.Text: If unattached, the first player claims Scatha’s Teeth and attaches it to a hero he controls. Action: Exhaust Scatha’s Teeth and attached hero to choose a player. That player reduces his threat by 2.

The Cursed Tomb.Text: Immune to player card effects. The players cannot travel to The Cursed Tomb unless they control 3 Loot objectives. Forced: After the player travel to The Cursed Tomb, search the encounter deck and discard pile for Fram’s Shade and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Fram’s Shade makes an immediate attack against each player in turn order.

Fram\u2019s Shade.Text: Cannot have non-objective attachments. Fram’s Shade gets +1 $, +1 Û, and +1 Ú for each Loot objective the players control. When Fram’s Shade is dealt shadow cards, deal it a number of shadow cards equal to the number of Loot objectives the players control (to a minimum of 1).

Crypt Stalker.Text: X is the tens digit of the first player’s threat. Forced: When Crypt Stalker attacks, raise the defending player’s threat by 1.
Crypt Stalker.Shadow: Shadow: Either raise your threat by 2, or return attacking enemy to the staging area.

Evil Spectre.Text: Forced: When Evil Spectre is destroyed, shuffle it back into the encounter deck if the active location has the Dark trait.
Evil Spectre.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the active location has the Dark trait.)

Forgotten Crypt.Text: Immune to player card effects. Forced: After Forgotten Crypt becomes the active location, discard cards from the encounter deck until an Undead enemy is discarded and add it to the staging area. Then, attach a Loot objective in the encounter discard pile to that enemy as a guarded objective.

Haunted Hall.Text: Discover 4. While Dark Hall is in the staging area, it gains, “Forced: After a player places any amount of progress on a Dark location in the staging area, he raises his threat by 1.”

Hidden Staircase.Text: Discover X.  X is the tens digit of the first player’s threat. Forced: After resolving the Discover keyword on Hidden Staircase, reduce each player’s threat by X if no Hazard cards were revealed by it.

Moonlit Passage.Text: Discover 2. While Moonlit Passage is in the staging area, each player’s threat cannot be reduced by more than 1 via player card effects each round.

Cursed Tower.Text: Discover 3. While Cursed Tower is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After a player plays an event, raise his threat by 1.”
Cursed Tower.Shadow: Shadow: Discard a non-objective attachment you control.

Abandoned Ruins.Text: When Revealed: Each player resolves the Discover keyword of the active location in turn order. If they cannot, Abandoned Ruins gains surge and doomed 2.

Terrible Shadows.Text: When Revealed: Each character gets –1 Ò, –1 Û, and –1 Ú until the end of the round.
Terrible Shadows.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, raise the defending player’s threat by 3.

Slammed Shut.Text: Doomed 1. When Revealed: Each player chooses an exhausts a character he controls. Until the end of the round, characters cannot be readied by player card effects.

The Cursed Shade.Text: When Revealed: The first player adds The Cursed Tomb to the staging area. Each other player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a non-unique Undead enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Dark Horseman.Encounter Set: A Shadow of the Past - Nightmare
Dark Horseman.Keywords: Peril. Hide 2. Cannot have non-Morgul attachments.
Dark Horseman.Text: While Dark Horseman is engaged with you, characters you control get -1 Ò during Hide tests.

Eastfarthing.Encounter Set: A Shadow of the Past - Nightmare
Eastfarthing.Text:
Eastfarthing gets +2 $ for each resource token on it.
Forced: After a player fails a Hide test, place 1 resource token here.

While Green-Hill Country is in the staging area, add 1 to each Hide X value.

Sniffing and Hissing.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +2 Û. If this attack destroys a character, raise your threat by 3.

Menacing Wraith.Encounter Set: A Knife in the Dark - Nightmare

X is the number of characters the first player controls.
Travel: The first player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Spy enemy, reveals it, and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

The Ring's Will.Text: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by 5. This effect cannot be canceled by the Ring-bearer's effect, or if The One Ring is exhausted.
The Ring's Will.Shadow: Shadow: After this attack, attacking enemy engages the next player then makes an immediate attack.

Blade Tip.Encounter Set: A Knife in the Dark - Nightmare
Blade Tip.Shadow: Shadow: If the defending character is damaged by this attack, attach Blade Tip to that character. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, raise your threat by 2.")

Trollshaw Forest.Text:
While Trollshaw Forest is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: After a 'when revealed' effect is canceled, reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1."
Travel: Reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1 to travel here.

Great East Road.Text:
X is 1 plus the number of Nazgûl enemies in play.
While Great East Road is in the staging area, each Nazgûl enemy gets -5 engagement cost.
Great East Road.Shadow: Shadow: After this attack, attacking enemy engages the next player then makes an immediate attack.

Pathless Wilderness.Text:
Pathless Wilderness enters play with 3 resource tokens on it.
Forced: At the end of the round, discard 1 resource token here. Then, if there are no resource tokens here, reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 3.

Ettendales.Text: Forced: When Ettendales is explored, shuffle the top card of the burden deck into the encounter deck.
Ettendales.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +2 Û. If this attack destroys a character, reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1.

Come Back!.Text: When Revealed: Reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1 and remove all progress from the current quest.
Come Back!.Shadow: Shadow: Either reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1, or this attack is considered undefended.

The Twilight World.Text: When Revealed: Attach to the Ring-bearer. Limit 1 per hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: At the beginning of the planning phase, either exhaust The One Ring, or reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1.")

Pine Slopes.Encounter Set: Dungeons Deep and Caverns Dim - Nightmare
Pine Slopes.Text: Forced: Each time a Í resource is spent or discarded, raise each player's threat by 1.

Necromancer's Warg.Text: Forced: After Necromancer's Warg engages you, deal 1 damage to a character you control.

Erkenbrand.Text: While Erkenbrand is defending, he gains: "Response: Deal 1 damage to Erkenbrand to cancel a shadow effect just triggered."

The Day's Rising.Text: Response: After attached hero defends against an attack and takes no damage while defending that attack, exhaust Day's Rising to add 1 resource to the attached hero's resource pool.

Captain of Gondor.Text: Response: After you optionally engage an enemy, exhaust Capatain of Gondor to give attached hero +1 Û and +1 Ú until the end of the round.

Booming Ent.Keywords: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted.
Booming Ent.Text: Booming Ent gets +1 Û for each damaged Ent character you control.

Ride Them Down.Text: Quest Action: Choose a non-unique enemy in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, progress would be placed on the quest for questing successfully is instead assigned as damage to the chosen enemy. (Progress must still be placed on any active location first.)

Shadows Give Way.Keywords: You must use resources from 3 different heroes' pools to pay for this card.
Shadows Give Way.Text: Action: Discard each shadow card from each enemy in play.

Don't be Hasty!.Text: Response: When an encounter card is revealed but before resolving any of that card's keywords or "when revealed" effects, choose a character committed to the quest. Ready that character and remove it from the quest.

Waters of Nimrodel.Text: Action: Heal all damage on each character in play.

Battle for Dunland.Text: Setup: The first player takes control of Chief Turch. Set Raven Chief and Raven Chief’s Camp aside, out of play. Reveal 1 copy of Dunland Battlefield and make it the active location. Reveal 1 copy of Raven War-camp and add it to the staging area. Create the Raven deck (see insert) and set it next to the quest deck. Each player chooses 1 different enemy from the Raven deck and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck and Raven deck.

The Raven Clan.Text: When Revealed: Shuffle the Raven deck discard pile into the Raven deck. Then, starting with the first player, each player takes the top card of the Raven deck and adds it to the staging area.

The Last Stage.Text: When Revealed: Add Raven Chief and Raven Chief’s Camp to the staging area. Take the top X cards from the Raven deck and add them to the staging area. X is the number of players minus 1.

Chief Turch.Text:
Cannot have attachments. 
  
 Cannot leave play. 
  
 Chief Turch engages the first player. 
  
Forced: After an enemy engages a player, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

Raven Chief.Keywords: Cannot have attachments. While Raven Chief’s Camp is in play, Raven Chief cannot be damaged.
Raven Chief.Text: Forced: When Raven Chief attacks, remove 1 time counter from the active location, if able.

Raven Chief's Camp.Text: Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this location, exhaust each damaged character. Place 3 time counters on this location.

Raven Warrior.Text: Forced: After Raven Warrior engages a player, remove X time counters from locations in play. X is the number of cards in the engaged player’s hand.

Raven Skirmisher.Text: When Revealed: Either remove 1 time counter from the active location, or reveal an additional encounter card.
Raven Skirmisher.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +X Û, where X is the Time X value on the active location.

Raven War-camp.Text: Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this location, starting with the first player, each player draws the top card of the Raven deck and puts it into play engaged with him.

Raven Village.Text: Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this location, reveal the top card of the Raven deck and add it to the staging area.
Raven Village.Shadow: Shadow: Deal attacking enemy 2 additional shadow cards from the Raven deck.

Dunland Battlefield.Text: Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this location, each player assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is the number of cards in his hand.
Dunland Battlefield.Shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

Raven Country.Text: Time 4. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this location, each player raises his threat by the number of cards in his hand.
Raven Country.Shadow: Shadow: Defending player assigns X damage among characters he controls. X is the Time X value on the active location.

Raising the Cry.Text: When Revealed: Remove 1 time counter from each location in play. Place X time counters on each location in play with no time counters on it. X is the “Time X” value on that location. If there are no locations in the staging area, Raising the Cry gains surge.

Fierce Folk.Text: When Revealed: Each player draws 3 cards. Until the end of the round, players cannot play events.
Fierce Folk.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, remove 1 time counter from the active location.

Driven Back.Text: When Revealed: Remove all progress from each location in the staging area. Increase the total $ in the staging area by 1 for each progress removed this way. If no progress was removed by this effect, Driven Back gains surge.

Nor.Text: Action: Remove 1 resource token from Nor to give him a resource icon of your choice until the end of the phase.

Longbeard Cavern.Text:
While Longbeard Cavern is the active location Dwarf allies cost 1 less resource to play.

While Longbeard Cavern is in play Nor gains 'Action: Exhaust Nor to add 2 resource tokens to his resource pool (Limit once per round)'

Treacherous Slope.Text:
Action: If there are more than X enemies in play, exhaust a Hero to claim Treacherous Slope. X equals twice the number of players. Attach Treacherous Slope to that Hero.

Action: If claimed, place Treacherous Slope in the victory display to trigger an avalanche. Each player may reduce thier threat by 2 for each enemy engaged with them then discard all enemies from play.

The Diversion.Text: When Revealed: Each player must choose at least 1 of their heros and any number of their allies to join the diversion party. Flip over all the characters not in the diversion party along with thier attachments. Face down cards are considered to be out of play.

The Rescue.Text: When Revealed: Discard all locations from play. Flip over all player cards (All cards involved in the diversion will now be face down and all other cards will be face up). Face down cards are considered to be out of play.

Lord of Morthond.Keywords: Attach to a Gondor or Outlands hero.
Lord of Morthond.Text: If each hero you control has a printed Ì resource icon, Lord of Morthond gains: "Response: After you play a Î, Ê, or Ï ally, draw 1 card."

Book of Eldacar.Text:
Reduce the cost to play Book of Eldacar by 1 for each hero you control with a printed Ï resource icon.

Action: Discard Book of Eldacar to play any Ï event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

Gondorian Discipline.Text: Response: Cancel up to 2 points of damage just dealt to a Gondor character.

Minas Tirith Lampwright.Text: Response: After an encounter card with surge is revealed, discard Minas Tirith Lampwright to name enemy, location, or treachery. If the next encounter card revealed is the named type, discard it without resolving its effects.

Small Target.Text: Response: After a Hobbit hero you control exhausts to defend an attack, choose another enemy engaged with you and reveal the attacking enemy's shadow card. If that shadow card has no shadow effect, resolve this enemy's attack against the chosen enemy. If that shadow card has a shadow effect, resolve this attack as normal.

Ithilien Archer.Text: Response: After Ithilien Archer attacks and damages an enemy, return that enemy to the staging area.

Ithilien Pit.Text:
Play Ithilien Pit into the staging area unattached.

If unattached, attach Ithilien Pit to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.

Any character may choose attached enemy as the target of an attack.

Hobbit-sense.Keywords: Play only if each of your heroes is a Hobbit.
Hobbit-sense.Text: Combat Action: Enemies engaged with you do not attack this round. You cannot declare attacks this round.

Savagery of the Orcs.Text: Setup: Set Ghulat aside, out of play. Put Lord Alcaron into play. Make Burning Farmhouse the active location. Add the Rescued Villagers and Dead Villagers objectives to the staging area. Then, shuffle the encounter deck and reveal 1 encounter card per player and add it to the staging area.

Protect the Villagers.Text: When Revealed: Add Ghulat to the staging area.

Rescued Villagers.Text:
If a location leaves play as an explored location, move any villager tokens from that location to Rescued Villagers.

At the end of the game, if there are more villager tokens here than damage tokens on Dead Vilagers, the players have won.

Dead Villagers.Text:
If a villager token is discarded from a location, objective or quest stage, place a damage token on Dead Villagers.

At the end of the game, if there are more damage tokens here than villager tokens on Rescued Villagers, the players have lost.

Marauding Orc.Text: Forced: After Marauding Orc attacks and destroys a character, place 1 damage token on Dead Villagers.
Marauding Orc.Shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, discard 1 villager token from Rescued Villagers.

Craven Eagle.Text: When Revealed: Discard the character with the fewest remaining hit points. That character's controller may discard 3 cards at random from his hand to prevent this effect.

Burning Farmhouse.Text: Forced: At the end of the round, discard 1 villager token from Burning Farmhouse.

Gondorian Hamlet.Text: While Gondorian Hamlet is in the staging area it gains: "Forced: After a treachery card is revealed from the encounter deck, discard 1 villager token from Gondorian Hamlet."

Secluded Farmhouse.Text: Travel: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck and add it to the staging area to travel here.

Burnt Homestead.Text: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by the number of damage tokens on Dead Villagers.
Burnt Homestead.Shadow: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by 1 for each damage token on Dead Villagers.

Trapped Inside.Text: When Revealed: Discard 1 villager token from the active location for each player in the game. If no villager tokens were removed by this effect, Trapped Inside gains surge.
Trapped Inside.Shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, discard 1 villager token from Rescued Villagers.

Panicked!.Text: When Revealed: Each player must take a villager token from Rescued Villagers and place it on a location in the staging area, if able. If no villager tokens were placed on a location by this effect, Panicked! gains surge.
Panicked!.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each damage token on Dead Villagers.

Sword of Morthond.Text: Attached ally gains the Outlands trait.

Men of the West.Text: Action: Return X Outlands allies from your discard pile to your hand.

Knight of Minas Tirith.Text:
If each of your heroes has a printed Ï resource icon, Knight of Minas Tirith gains: 
"Response: After Knight of Minas Tirith enters play, choose an enemy in the staging area. Engage that enemy and exhaust Knight of Minas Tirith to declare it as attacker (and resolve its attack) against that enemy."

Gondorian Fire.Keywords: Attach to a Gondor or Dunedain hero.
Gondorian Fire.Text: Action: Spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to give attached hero +1 Û for each resource in its resource pool until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

Pelargir Shipwright.Text: Pelargir Shipwright gets +1 Ò for each hero you control with a printed Ê resource icon.

Map of Earnil.Text:
Reduce the cost to play Map of Earnil by 1 for each hero you control with a printed Ê resource icon. 

Action: Discard Map of Earnil to play any Ê event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

Ranger Bow.Keywords: Attach to a Ranger character. Restricted.
Ranger Bow.Text: Action: Exhaust Ranger Bow and attached character to deal 1 damage to an enemy in the staging area.

Forest Patrol.Keywords: Play only if you control at least 1 Ranger character.
Forest Patrol.Text: Action: Deal 3 damage to an enemy with at least 1 Trap card attached to it.

Palantir.Text: Planning Action: Exhaust Palantir and attached hero to name a card type and look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. For each of those cards that matches the named type, draw a card. For each of those cards that does not match the named type, raise your threat by 2.

Retake the City.Text: Setup: Each player chooses 1 enemy and 1 unique location and add them to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Uruk Lieutenant.Text: When Revealed: Add the topmost Orc enemy from the encounter discard pile to the staging area.
Uruk Lieutenant.Shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards an attachment he controls. (All attachments he controls instead if undefended.)

Southron Phalanx.Text: While engaged with a player, Southron Phalanx gets +1 Û for each location that player controls.
Southron Phalanx.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each location the defending player controls.

Southron Commander.Text: When Revealed: Southron Commander makes an immediate attack from the staging area against each player who controls at least 1 location.

The King's Library.Text:
Travel: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck and add it to the staging area to travel here.

Forced: After the player who controls The King's Library lets an attack go undefended, return The King's Library to the staging area.

Ancient Harbor.Text:
Combat Action: Exhaust a hero to place 1 progress token on Ancient Harbor.

Forced: After the player who controls Ancient Harbor lets an attack go undefended, return Ancient Harbor to the staging area.

The Old Bridge.Text:
Planning Action: Spend 2 resources to place 1 progress token on The Old Bridge. (1 resource instead if there is another Osgiliath location in the staging area.)

Forced: After the player who controls The Old Bridge lets an attack go undefended, return The Old Bridge to the staging area.

West Quarter.Text: While West Quarter is the active location, the current quest gains siege. (Characters quest using Ú instead of Ò.)
West Quarter.Shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, that character's controller must return a location he controls with the highest $ to the staging area.

East Quarter.Text: While East Quarter is the active location, the current quest gains battle. (Characters quest using Û instead of Ò.)
East Quarter.Shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, that character's controller must return a location he controls with the highest $ to the staging area.

Ruined Square.Text:
Response: After an enemy is defeated, place 1 progress token on Ruined Square.

Forced: If a player controls Ruined Square when a character leaves play, return Ruined Square to the staging area.

Ruined Tower.Text:
Travel: If there is 1 active location, exhaust a character to travel here. (There are now 2 active locations.)

Forced: After the player who controls Ruined Tower loses control of a location, return Ruined Tower to the staging area.

Pinned Down.Text: When Revealed: Add X to the archery total this round. X is the number of locations the players control. If the players control less than 4 locations, Pinned Down gains surge.
Pinned Down.Shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, that character's controller must return a location he controls with the highest $ to the staging area.

Counter-attack.Text: When Revealed: Each player must return the location he controls with the highest $ to the staging area, or raise his threat by the total $ of all locations he controls.

Caldara.Text: Action: Discard Caldara to put 1 Spirit ally from your discard pile into play for each other hero you control with a printed Spirit resource icon.

Squire of the Citadel.Text: Response: After Squire of the Citadel leaves play, add 1 resource to a Gondor hero's resource pool.

Tome of Atanatar.Text: Reduce the cost to play Tome of Atanatar by 1 for each you control with the printed Leadership resource icon. Action: Discard Tome of Atanatar to play any Leadership event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

Guthlaf.Text: If there is at least 1 Rohan hero in play, lower the cost to play Guthlaf by 1. If there is at least 1 Gondor hero in play, Guthlaf gains sentinel.

The Hammer-stroke.Text: Encounter Action: Engage each enemy in play.

Emery.Text: Action: Discard the top 3 card of your deck to put Emery into play from your hand, under any player's control. Then, if any of the discarded cards have the Tactics, Lore or Leadership sphere, discard Emery.

Children of the Sea.Text: Action: Choose a Silvan or Noldor ally you control. That ally gets +2 Willpower until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase, shuffle that ally into its owner's deck if it is still in play.

Poisoned Stakes.Text: Play Poisoned Stakes into the staging area unattached. If unattached, attach Poisoned Stakes to the next eligble enemy that enters the staging area. At the end of each round, deal 2 damage to attached enemy.

Well-Equipped.Text: Action: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck. You may attach 1 attachment card discarded by this effect to an eligible Dwarf character in play.

The Ambush.Text: Setup: Add the Crossroads and Black Númenorean to the staging area. Put the Faramir and Lord Alcaron objective allies into play. Shuffle the encounter deck and reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player and add it to the staging area.

Orc Ambusher.Text: Forced: After Orc Ambusher engages you, discard 1 non-objective ally you control, if able.
Orc Ambusher.Shadow: Attack enemy gets +1 Û (+3 Û instead if undefended).

Brutal Uruk.Text: Forced: After Brutual Uruk attacks and destroys a character, that character's controller turns all hidden cards in his play area faceup. Deal a shadow card to each enemy turned faceup by this effect and resolve their attacks as normal.

Southern Road.Text: Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

Western Road.Text: Western Road gets +5 quest points while it is in the staging area. Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

Northern Road.Text: Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

Eastern Road.Text: Eastern Road gets +5 quest points while it is in the staging area. Travel: The first player must take 2 hidden cards to travel here.

The Dark Woods.Text: X is the number of players in the game. Forced: After The Dark Woods leaves play as an explored location, the first player discards 1 hidden card.

Lying in Wait.Text: When Revealed: The first player turns each hidden card in his play area faceup. Resolve the "When Revealed" effects of each encounter cards turned faceup by this effect. If a location is turned faceup, add it to the staging area.

Mordor Looms.Text: When Revealed: Each player takes 1 hidden card.
Mordor Looms.Shadow: If this attack destoys a characters, that character's controller turns each of his hidden cards faceup.

Conflict at the Crossroads.Text: When Revealed: Until the end of the phase, Orc enemies engaged with players add their Threat to the staging area. If no Orc enemies are engaged with players, Conflict at the Crossroads gains surge.

We Must Away, Ere Break of Day.Encounter Set: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day - Nightmare
We Must Away, Ere Break of Day.Text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

A Murder of Crows.Encounter Set: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day - Nightmare
A Murder of Crows.Text:
When Revealed: Reveal a random card from the encounter discard pile and add it to the staging area, if able.

Forced: If A Murder of Crows would be destroyed, shuffle it back into the encounter deck instead.

Red River-bank.Encounter Set: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day - Nightmare
Red River-bank.Text: Forced: At the beginning of the refresh phase, place the top card of the encounter discard pile on the bottom of the encounter deck and raise each player's threat by that card's $.

Wicked Hilltops.Encounter Set: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day - Nightmare
Wicked Hilltops.Text: Forced: After placing 1 or more progress tokens on Wicked Hilltops, each player must discard an ally he controls without an attached Sack card.
Wicked Hilltops.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +2 Û. (+3 Û instead if attacking enemy is a Troll.)

Comfortable Light.Encounter Set: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day - Nightmare
Comfortable Light.Text:
Progress cannot be placed here.

Travel: Sack 1

Forced: After Comfortable Light becomes the active location, discard it.

Mince Them Fine.Encounter Set: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day - Nightmare
Mince Them Fine.Text: When Revealed: Each engaged Troll enemy makes an immediate attack. If the players are at stage 1, immediately advance to stage 2A.
Mince Them Fine.Shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is a Troll, return it to the staging area after this attack.

Night Wanes Slow.Encounter Set: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day - Nightmare
Night Wanes Slow.Text:
Forced: When this card is discarded from the top of the encounter deck as a result of a quest card effect, immediately stop making progress and end the quest phase.

When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Reveal 1 additional encounter card.

One by One.Encounter Set: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day - Nightmare
One by One.Text: When Revealed: Choose and destroy a character with a Sack card attached. Then, return that Sack card to the top of the Sack deck and Sack 1.

Over the Misty Mountains Grim.Encounter Set: Over the Misty Mountains Grim - Nightmare
Over the Misty Mountains Grim.Text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

Narrow Ledge.Encounter Set: Over the Misty Mountains Grim - Nightmare
Narrow Ledge.Text: While Narrow Ledge is the active location, each player cannot commit more than 3 characters to the quest.
Narrow Ledge.Shadow: Shadow: Shuffle all copies of Galloping Boulders from the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

Dim Valley.Encounter Set: Over the Misty Mountains Grim - Nightmare
Dim Valley.Text:
Action: Exhaust Bilbo Baggins and spend 1 Í resource to place 5 progress on Dim Valley.

Forced: At the end of the round, each player must discard a random card from his hand.

Lightning Splinters.Encounter Set: Over the Misty Mountains Grim - Nightmare
Lightning Splinters.Text: When Revealed: Each player must choose and discard 3 cards from his hand. Each player assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is the combined printed cost of the cards he discarded.

Goblin Prowler.Text:
Goblin Prowler gets -30 engagement cost if The Great Goblin is in the victory display.

Forced: When Goblin Prowler engages you, discard a character you control.

Dark Passages.Text:
When Revealed: Choose a location in the staging area with a title other than Dark Passages and make it the active location. (If there was already an active location, there are now 2 active locations.)

Travel: Raise each player's threat by X to travel here, where X is the number of Cave locations in the staging area.

Swish, smack! Whip crack!.Text: When Revealed: Each player must assign damage among characters he controls equal to the total number of Goblin enemies engaged with him and in the staging area.
Swish, smack! Whip crack!.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy cannot take damage this round.

Dungeons Deep and Caverns Dim.Encounter Set: Dungeons Deep and Caverns Dim - Nightmare
Dungeons Deep and Caverns Dim.Text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

The Lower Gate.Encounter Set: Dungeons Deep and Caverns Dim - Nightmare
The Lower Gate.Text:
No more than 4 progress can be placed on the current quest each round.

Creature enemies get +1 Û.

Goblin enemies get +1 Ú.

Wicked Wolf.Encounter Set: Dungeons Deep and Caverns Dim - Nightmare
Wicked Wolf.Text: Forced: If Wicked Wolf is dealt a shadow card with a riddle, the defending player must exhaust a character he controls.
Wicked Wolf.Shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

Lower Gate Sentries.Encounter Set: Dungeons Deep and Caverns Dim - Nightmare
Lower Gate Sentries.Text: Bilbo's Magic Ring does not ready during the refresh phase.
Lower Gate Sentries.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. (+3 Û instead if Bilbo's Magic Ring is exhausted.)

Where isss It?.Encounter Set: Dungeons Deep and Caverns Dim - Nightmare
Where isss It?.Text:
When Revealed: Discard 2 resources from Bilbo Baggins's resource pool, or Gollum makes an attack against Bilbo Baggins.

Riddle: The first player names a sphere, a cost, and a card type, shuffles his deck, and discards the top 3 cards. For each card that matches all three items, place 1 progress on stage 2.

We Hates It!.Encounter Set: Dungeons Deep and Caverns Dim - Nightmare
We Hates It!.Text:
When Revealed: Attach We Hates It! to Gollum. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "If the players are on stage 3, Gollum gets +2 Û.")

Riddle: THe first player names a Trait, shuffles his deck, and discards the top card. For each card that has at least 1 matching Trait, place 1 progress on stage 2.

Celeborn.Text: Response: After a Silvan ally enters play, that ally gets +1 Ò, +1 Û, and +1 Ú until the end of the round.

Swift and Silent.Text: Action: Ready a hero you control. Then, if your threat is 20 or less and this is the first time you played a copy of Swift and Silent this round, return this card to your hand instead of discarding it.

Firefoot.Text:
Attach to a Ï or Rohan hero. Restricted.  
  
 Attached hero gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if attached hero is Éomer).  
  
 Response: After attached hero attacks alone, exhaust Firefoot to choose a non-unique enemy engaged with you. Excess damage dealt by this attack is assigned to the chosen enemy

Close Call.Text: Response: Cancel X damage just dealt to a hero.

The Fall of Gil-Galad.Text:
Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a hero.  
  
 Response: When attached hero is destroyed, add The Fall of Gil-galad to the victory display to reduce your threat by X, where X is the attached hero’s threat cost.

Ithilien Lookout.Text: Response: After Ithilien Lookout enters play, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If it is an enemy, you may discard it.

The Tree People.Text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Silvan ally. Put that ally into play and shuffle the other cards back into your deck. You can only play 1 copy of The Tree People each phase.

The White Council.Text:
X is the number of players in the game.  
  
 Action: Starting with the first player, each player chooses 1 different option: ready a hero he controls, add 1 resource to the resource pool of a hero he controls, draw 1 card, or shuffle 1 card from his discard pile into his deck.

The Road to Tharbad.Text: Setup: Set Chief Turch and Munuv Dûv Ravine aside, out of play. Make Old South Road the active location. Each player searches the encounter deck for a Boar Clan enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.

A Well Laid Trap.Text: When Revealed: Make Munuv Dûv Ravine the active location (returning any previous active location to the staging area). Each player discards each Item and each Mount attachment he controls. Each player chooses 1 ally he controls and discards each other ally he controls.

No Way Out.Text: When Revealed: Put Chief Turch into play, engaged with the first player.

Munuv Du\u0302v Ravine.Text: Dunland enemies get +1 Û and +1 Ú.

Old South Road.Text: Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

Boar Clan Stalker.Text:
Boar Clan Stalker gets +1 Û and +1 Ú for each resource token on it (limit +4). 
  
 Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards, put a resource token on Boar Clan Stalker.

Boar Clan Warrior.Text: Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards, deal Boar Clan Warrior a shadow card.
Boar Clan Warrior.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each shadow card on it.

Hithaeglir Foothills.Text:
X is the number of resource tokens on this card.  
  
 Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, place 1 resource token here.

Hills of Dunland.Text:
While Hills of Dunland is in the staging area, it gains: 'Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card is a Dunland enemy, put it into play engaged with that player. This ability does not stack with other copies of Hills of Dunland. 
  
 Travel: Each player draws a card to travel here.

Plains of Enedwaith.Text: While Plains of Enedwaith is the active location, players do not draw a card during the resource phase.
Plains of Enedwaith.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+3 Û instead if undefended).

Hithaeglir Stream.Text: While Hithaeglir Stream is the active location, players draw 2 cards during the resource phase instead of 1.
Hithaeglir Stream.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. Deal it an additional shadow card.

Frenzied Attack.Text: When Revealed: Each player draws a card. Each player discards each ally from his hand. If no allies are discarded this way, Frenzied Attack gains surge.
Frenzied Attack.Shadow: Shadow: Until the end of the round, attacking enemy cannot take damage.

Dunlending Ambush.Text: When Revealed: Attach to the active location. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: 'Limit 1 per location. Forced: After attached location is explored, each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Dunland enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.')
